FuncDef:
The ppp-user-warning-threshold command sets an alarm threshold for PPP users allowed to access the device. If the percentage of PPP users currently accessing the device reaches the threshold, an alarm is generated.
The undo ppp-user-warning-threshold command removes the alarm threshold set for users allowed to access the device.
By default, the alarm threshold for the number of PPP users allowed to access from the device is 100.

ParaDef.Info:
Alarm threshold.
If the alarm threshold is set to 10, it indicates that if the percentage of the number of PPP users currently accessing the device to the maximum number of users allowed to access the device reaches 10%, an alarm is generated.
The value is in integer, ranging from 1 to 100.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After you run this command, if the percentage of the number of PPP users currently accessing the device to the maximum number of users allowed to access the device reaches the set threshold, an alarm is generated.
A dual-stack user will be counted as both an IPv6 user and an IPv4 user.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
